comments.author: timo.teklas@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; fi; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; fi; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15

Synology NAS units can not be controlled properly with Firefox+Java. IE8+same version of Java works prefectly.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Login to Synology NAS (209 or 110j) firmware 3.1 as admin.
2.Try to upload something to any regular user's folders.
3.You get always error message from missing privileges.
4. Do the same with IE, it works.
Actual Results:  
You have to abandon Firefox if you need to adminitrate Synology products.

Expected Results:  
Get necessary data transferred, there is nothing wrong with privileges, only with the browser.

There are several comments about this malfunction in Synology forum. It's not sure whether it is Firefox or Java problem. I am just too dummy to find the real reason.
comments.creator: timo.teklas@gmail.com
